title: Unit testing
description: Unit testing options for Angular applications.

buildTarget.description: A build builder target to serve in the format of `project:target[:configuration]`. You can also pass in more than one configuration name as a comma-separated list. Example: `project:target:production,staging`.

tsConfig.description: The name of the TypeScript configuration file.

runner.description: The name of the test runner to use for test execution.

include.description:
Globs of files to include, relative to project root. 
There are 2 special cases:
 - when a path to directory is provided, all spec files ending ".spec.@(ts|tsx)" will be included
 - when a path to a file is provided, and a matching spec file exists it will be included instead.

exclude.description: Globs of files to exclude, relative to the project root.

codeCoverageExclude.description: Globs to exclude from code coverage.

reporters.description: Test runner reporters to use. Directly passed to the test runner.
